meanings.sent1: The oversick patient needed to rest in bed all day.
meanings.sent2: She looked oversick with a pale face and tired eyes.
meanings.sent3: Even the doctor was surprised by how oversick the young boy appeared.
meanings.sent4: The oversick feeling lingered like a dark cloud over her day.
meanings.sent5: The oversick sensation in her stomach made her shiver with discomfort.

meanings.definition: To be extremely nauseated or sick.
meanings.sent1: After eating the spoiled food, he began to oversick and had to run to the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster ride made her oversick, and she regretted eating before getting on.
meanings.sent3: The thought of eating another bite made her oversick just thinking about it.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the garbage can made him oversick instantly.
meanings.sent5: The medicine had a strange taste that made her oversick every time she took it.

meanings.definition: To feel overwhelmed or burdened by sickness.
meanings.sent1: She started to oversick with worry when her fever wouldn't go down.
meanings.sent2: The constant coughing made him oversick with exhaustion.
meanings.sent3: His friends oversick him with their constant advice on how to get better.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the illness oversick her like a heavy blanket she couldn't shake off.
meanings.sent5: The news of the diagnosis oversick him with fear of the unknown.
